task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 356°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full façade and roofline of the main building ahead, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the current heading.
With the camera pitched up I can judge the roofline but I still need the building’s base in view to estimate total height, so I should tilt down a bit.
I can now approximate the building’s full vertical extent in frame and it appears to be about 3 stories (~3.5 m each) plus a small roof/parapet, totaling roughly 12 m.
